Job_Title: Technology Incident & Change Management, Associate | Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Technology Incident & Change Management, Associate | Singapore Description About this role About BlackRock: BlackRock is one of the world's preeminent asset management firms and an outstanding provider of global investment management, risk management and advisory services to institutional, intermediary and individual investors around the world. Your team: Come work with us at one of the world's top FinTech companies! The Command Center and Control team runs Incident, Problem and Change Management processes ensuring the stability of the Aladdin platform while supporting a fast pace of innovation for BlackRock and our external clients. Your role and Impact: You will be responsible for managing some of the most critically important production incidents and technologically sophisticated changes in the industry. An individual in this role will have the opportunity to build relationships with Business and Technology teams across the region and globe through exposure to financial market workflows, applications, and technologies both crafted and adopted by BlackRock. This role will put one in a position to develop the overarching knowledge of how several teams collaborate to deliver services to end users and drive business impact lead by a culture of preparedness and quality. A successful candidate will support Aladdin, seek critical business-impacting incidents and lead communication between business groups during production impacting incidents, communicate the impact of high-risk changes and releases to technology and business partners while securing approvals and consensus from the Change Advisory Board. This position is also responsible for coordinating security patching across the technology infrastructure including working early shifts or working weekends (both on a rotational basis) to support patch implementation with the mission to achieve the firm's compliance and security goals. You have: The candidate is encouraged to have proven knowledge and experience in all parts of the IT delivery life cycle. We are seeking talent that has a passion for technical troubleshooting, thinks in an innovative way, values teamwork, has emotional ownership, and will go above and beyond to help develop the company. Our team has wide and multifaceted abilities, but we would encourage applications from candidates with the following skills: 4+ years of experience in a production/application support or client services role; financial services a plus Experience operating within an ITIL framework Background in supporting critically important applications Ability to prioritize multiple concurrent demands Basic technical skills in the following areas - desktop technology, TCP/IP networking, UNIX commands, SQL queries, and an understanding of SDLC Excellent oral and written communication skills. Good interpersonal skills and attention to detail Ability to work both independently and as part of a team effort Quick learner who will learn new systems or processes, highly motivated individual who takes full ownership of responsibilities Your advantages: Knowledge of security standard methodologies, operating system patching, and CVEs Experience and knowledge of change control principles, methodologies, and tools Knowledge of cloud computing platforms like Azure, AWS, etc. and understanding of different service models (IaaS, PaaS, SaaS) Scripting or basic development language skills to automate common tasks We are a global but close-knit team of individuals who share a common goal of providing the very best possible level of support to our business partners and customers. From the top of the firm down, we embrace the diversity of values, identities and ideas brought by our employees. We are serious about our people and offer Flexible Time Off, collaborative working spaces and several other benefits. If any of this excites you, we would love to speak to you! Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. For additional information on BlackRock, please visit careers.blackrock.com | www.blackrock.com/corporate | Instagram: @blackrock | Twitter: @blackrock | LinkedIn: www.linkedin.com/company/blackrock BlackRock is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, and other statuses protected by law. BlackRock will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest or conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of the law, including any applicable fair chance law.

Job_Title: First VP, Decision Management Team Lead, Group Retail
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department Division Decision Management Solution is part of the wider Risk and Decision Management (R&DM) Division that is responsible for developing, implementing and monitoring risk and decision management models for UOB's Group Retail Bank. 'Analytics Support & Decision Management Solution' team has been set up to execute the initiatives to (1) equip R&DM team members with the right tools, e.g. analytics tool, data, infrastructure, and (2) support the enabling of analytics to the users within Group Retail segment. The Bank implemented the Decision Management Solution ('DMS'), for Singapore and regional subsidiaries (Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand and Malaysia). The DMS Team Lead role will lead the Group DMS Team to drive and develop the rules configuration & framework, for Business as Usual (BAU) quarterly policy changes, scorecard project changes and guide Implementation Projects on DMS solution for both Singapore & subsidiaries. Job Responsibilities Role's main areas as follows: 1) Rules Deployment: Manage DMS Configuration team (functional specialists) for rules deployment (from Change Requests Analysis, execute changes (configuration), test planning & execution). 2) Rules Development & Framework: Guide DMS Configuration team to manage design & development of DMS rules framework and codes 3) Manage 'DMS change prioritization forum': As the solution supports various types of rules (e.g. business rules, credit / overlay rules, and scorecard rules), for multiple stakeholders, with different requirements and urgency. DMS team lead will facilitate deliberation among stakeholders. 4) Solution Governor of DMS solution: this role will handle administrative/ process matters (e.g. set up solution governance framework), system custodian functions and enhancements to the solution (e.g. change to the data platform, version upgrade). This requires he/she to work with vendor and IT, including project support for the DMS upgrade Y2022-Y2023. - Provide support to AS Head on development of DMS team and DMS related infrastructure framework - Manage DMS prioritization forum to deliberate on the Change Requests, Projects and issues pertaining to DMS, to drive discussion and issues resolution. - Responsible for DMS rules deployment - planning, executing, testing and monitoring. To oversee the team for design & development of DMS rules framework and codes, used for both Singapore and subsidiaries - Identify improvement areas and provide recommendations to users and Head of AS team. - DMS Governor - maintenance of DMS rules configuration ~ Establish governance process, e.g. ensuring entry / exit criteria, maker/checker & code review process are in place ~ Drive & lead 'DMS prioritization forum' (current monthly CR meeting with stakeholders o Empower functional specialists to perform analysis to facilitate the discussion / decision process & recommend proposals. Team Lead will review their analysis and findings for solution/ effective change implementation o Drive forum to prioritize Change Requests with different stakeholders o Present to stakeholders and/or senior management on the assigned topics o Oversee and coordinate DMS changes e.g. change of data model, version upgrade, release plan. o Owner of DMS Change request inventory and provide regular update /tracking. ~ Owner of DMS artefacts (e.g. Rules specification, Code release/version inventory, audit or IT documents, process inventory) - Rules deployment - manage team for development & deployment release for followings o Develop & maintain DMS configuration specification o Translate business requirements to configuration specifications through close interactions with business users and solving the business problem o Perform DMS configuration and DMS-UAT testing /support o Develop and maintain relevant documents (e.g. test scope, test plan, test scenarios, test results, and entry / exit criteria) o Provide an update to Analytics Support Head on progress and issues - Provide advisory and lead support (as 'Group role') to the regional team - Provide regular updates to Head of R&DM and senior management on key developments and issues - Lead discussions and issues resolution process including cross function projects with digital Bank (TMRW) or strategic programs in the Bank. Lead or participate to support the Credit Portfolio Management Program (CPM) for vendor evaluation, review solution design and RFP evaluation for similar rules decision engine for regional customer management module. Job Requirements - Undergraduate degree in a relevant program - Good Project management background; with experience in planning, dependencies management, risk / issues management, and stakeholder management - Experience in Rules Development & Coding with Experian solution for Credit Origination (PCSM) / Customer Management (PCCM) will be preferred. Experience in Decision Management Engine (e.g. Blaze, Triad ) is added advantage - 6 to 8 years' related experience in retail credit portfolio / policies management. Consulting and risk vendor experiences will be considered - Exposure to IT systems and implementation projects o Appreciation of the System Development Life Cycle and project management methodologies, to perform and/or develop team on business analysis, business process mapping and user requirements gathering o Able to assess upstream and downstream impact from changes - Self-starter, flexible with a proven record in people / Team management - Able to perform in a non-structured environment. - Strong interpersonal skills. Able to interact effectively with a diverse group of people, including senior management, business managers and technical people - Experience in Retail Credit underwriting, credit policy and digitalization of credit application process will be advantage - Proficiency in tools like SQL, Relational Database and experience in Credit Decision Analytical Data Management will be a plus - Experience in JAVA language or Business Rules Engine code development will be a plus, and good knowledge of Machine Learning (ML) /Artificial Intelligence (AI) driven solution for Credit Underwriting processing and Data Analytics Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Job_Title: Citi TTS - Trade Asset Distribution Transactor (Vice President) - [21410164]
Job_Descriptions: Trade is part of Trade and Treasury Solutions and is one of the market leaders in providing Trade products to our corporate, PS and FI client base. An integral part of Trade’s growth strategy is our market leading ability to risk defease and distribute Trade assets. Trade Risk Distribution manages all activities related to the distribution, syndication, sell-down and insurance of risks related to "Trade" products, and the process of transferring / selling these risks, in order to achieve credit, cross-border, or balance sheet relief which is critical for the following reasons: (a) maintain a liquid asset book (b) achieve superior portfolio returns (c) manage asset levels (d) undertake large ticket transactions (e) overcome credit / cross-border / capital constraints The transactor would be an integral part of the Trade Asset Distribution team responsible for deal execution to achieve above objective on transaction and portfolio level basis Key Responsibilities: Distribution and risk defeasance of all trade asset classes: The person will be responsible for identification of the different avenues to defease risk related to a trade asset and execute the most optimal form of defeasance based on business needs Understanding of the different avenues of defeasance available including distribution, insurance, multilateral programs etc. Internal alignment with country / product / sale counterparts on what needs to be sold on specialized areas i.e Supplier & Receivable Finance FI (LCs and Loans), Export Agency Finance Fundamental ability to understand underlying Trade transaction and to communicate clearly to investors. Communicating with investors on transaction basis regarding specific transaction to be distributed Defeasance feedback / assessment: Provide up to date and timely feedback to the origination team on market pricing and appetite for trade assets. Conduct market reads for specific deals where necessary Managing "originate-to-distribute", trade structuring, clubs and syndications deals. Job_Descriptions: Audit Manager - Rates, Currencies and Commodities - Vice President The Audit Manager is an intermediate level role responsible for performing moderately complex audits and assessments of Citi's risk and control environments in coordination with the Audit team. The role will involve the risk assessment, annual planning, business monitoring and supporting the audit execution and reporting for the activities described. Job_Title: Treasury & Trade Solutions APAC Commercial Cards Product and Risk Manager
Job_Descriptions: Treasury & Trade Solutions APAC Commercial Cards Product and Risk Manager – Vice President Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions ("TTS") is a leading provider of cash management, treasury and trade solutions to Financial Institutions, Public Sector and Corporate clients around the world. TTS Global Commercial Cards is a leading commercial cards issuer with the largest global proprietary network, successfully serving the needs of large local and multinational organizations for more than 40 years with over 14,000 commercial card programs, 6 million cardholders and approximately US$42+ billion in annual charge volume globally.The Commercial Cards business supports comprehensive and digital cards solutions across Travel, B2B and VCA, Purchasing, and Meeting & Events to Citi’s institutional clients. Commercial Cards business in Asia represents over 13 countries with 200+ employees across product, sales, implementation, client service and operations. The business is expected to continue to be a major engine of growth in Asia with focus on digital solutions, business to business opportunities, e-commerce and the commercialization of product capabilities and origination of new business. Momentum is strong with revenues having doubled over the last few years. The position will be part of the APAC product team of the TTS Commercial Card and will be responsible for key product management and risk management in the business. Key Responsibilities: Responsible for Commercial Cards Product Management, Risk and Project Management Work with internal partners across Treasury & Trade Solutions (TTS), Institutional Clients Group (ICG), and the Functional Partners – globally, regionally and in country to drive the growth of cards within the broader B2B space. Participate actively in Global and Regional initiatives and work groups representing Commercial Cards business. Oversee the product strategy for a portfolio of B2B commercial card solutions and services, including traditional Purchasing Card solutions as well as emergent solutions. Lead key projects for commercial cards business across the region. Excellent organizational and management skills and possessesa natural capabilityto monitor and track a huge number of tasks. Oversight on Outsourcing & New Product activities of the cards product. Support requests for management reviews and audit deliverables and documentation Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy Owns centralized activities, metrics, and controls for Cards governance entity at the regional level. Manage the quarterly, semi-annual, and annual attestation of the completeness and accuracy of the Cards governance entity. Technical Engineer (Desktop, Network), Analyst Description About this role About the role: You can work with us at one of the world's top FinTech companies. We sell our Aladdin platform to over 200 of the top global corporations. We are a global but close-knit team of individuals who share a common goal of providing the very best possible level of support to our business partners and customers. From the top of the firm down, we embrace the diversity of values, identities and ideas brought by our employees. We are serious about our people and offer Flexible Time Off, collaborative working spaces and a number of other benefits. We have a wide and multifaceted stack and skillset, but we're particularly interested in meeting people with skills in some of the following: Strong Leadership, Data-driven Analysis, Linux, Networking Concepts, Distributed Databases, and Cloud Platform offerings like Microsoft Azure, Amazon AWS, and Google. We are looking for someone with a strong background in supporting mission-critical applications, a track record in outstanding service delivery across infrastructure and problem-solving. Team Overview: Platform Client Engagement (PCE) is part of the Platform Services group within BlackRock's Aladdin Product Group. Platform Services enhances our client's experience through a scalable hub for Operational Support, Client Engagement and Control across the Aladdin Platform. Platform Services supports over 200 external organizations that leverage Aladdin through BlackRock Solutions (BRS) offerings ( https://www.blackrock.com/aladdin/home ). PCE plays a crucial role liaising between our Aladdin business and the Aladdin platform providing technical support for Aladdin clients, owning the technical implementation of Aladdin at new BRS clients and providing business development support and management of projects for client technology requirements. PCE is a fast-paced team operating in a dynamic environment and provides the right individual with challenging work and an opportunity to lead cross functional groups in achieving a wide variety of objectives. Job Purpose / Responsibilities: The candidate will work across functions within PCE to provide leadership and mentorship to accomplish the team's strategic goals. In this role, PCE develops strong working relationships with BRS relationship managers and teams across the Aladdin Product Group. Aladdin Client Technical Support and Technical Initiatives Provide second level troubleshooting of client technical issues. Coordinate the technology implementation for new BRS Aladdin clients. Coordinate maintenance and support of client connectivity Additional technical work in support of the Aladdin business Additional Opportunities Due to the dynamic nature of the environment, PCE provides the opportunity for team members to participate across several functions, including Disaster Recovery planning for Aladdin, working with development teams on enhancements to operational tools, as well as opportunities to take ownership of various initiatives. Qualifications & Essential Skills: A successful candidate is expected to possess and demonstrate the following: Solid technical acumen including basic cloud technology, desktop technology and basic TCP/IP networking Ability to diagnose and fix technical issues with Windows operating systems Strong interpersonal and communication skills Self-motivated, driven and able to work in a team environment Ability to resolve conflicting high-priority requirements Strong leadership skills, including demonstrated ability to integrate multiple technical disciplines in achieving a stated objective Results-oriented professional committed to personally driving objectives to completion, maintaining flexibility where an adjusted work schedule and/or evening/weekend work are required 2+ years of experience in a technical support engineer, desktop support engineer, IT help desk, or similar role, financial services is a plus Desirable Skills: Experience troubleshooting Java-based applications running on Windows OS Scripting or basic development language skills to automate common tasks Strong technical writing skills or previous documentation experience and familiarity with Confluence Azure AZ-900 certification desired, but not required Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or technical related certification desired Japanese language skills is a plus, but not required Our benefits To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits including a strong retirement plan, tuition reimbursement, comprehensive healthcare, support for working parents and Flexible Time Off (FTO) so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about. About BlackRock At BlackRock, we are all connected by one mission: to help more and more people experience financial well-being. Our clients, and the people they serve, are saving for retirement, paying for their children's educations, buying homes and starting businesses. Their investments also help to strengthen the global economy: support businesses small and large; finance infrastructure projects that connect and power cities; and facilitate innovations that drive progress. This mission would not be possible without our smartest investment - the one we make in our employees. It's why we're dedicated to creating an environment where our colleagues feel welcomed, valued and supported with networks, benefits and development opportunities to help them thrive. About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department Analytics Support team is part of a wider Risk and Decision Management (R&DM) Division that is responsible for Risk/ Basel models implementation and enabling roll-out and tools via Quarterly Change Request (QR)  & Data management for UOB's Group Retail Bank, which covers exposures to consumers (Personal Financial Services ('PFS'), retail Small and Medium Enterprises (Business Banking ('BB')), and Private Banking ('PB') customers. Specifically, the division acts as an analytics function of Group Retail segment, to drive decision making based on value analytics throughout the customer value chain. Job Responsibilities 'Analytics Support & Decision Management Solution' team has been set up to execute the initiatives to (1) equip R&DM team members with the right tools, e.g. analytics tool, data, infrastructure, and (2) support the enabling of analytics to the users within Group Retail segment. In this role, the project team member anchor to manage Quarterly Change Requests delivery and enable Data management & tools for R&DM analytics  BAU and projects.  On project basis, he/she will participate & guide the assigned Singapore data-mart/ SAS /risk models initiatives for PFS & PB. Job Purpose ICE Data Services, a subsidiary of Intercontinental Exchange, is looking for high caliber sales professionals to join our growing team. The successful candidate will have a “hunter” type of profile and a background with emphasis on selling to new customers and generating additional business within existing accounts. The focus will be on growing business for our fast growing index business predominately into index or passive asset management firms, including ETF issuers, asset owners, sell-side research and structured product issuers. Additionally, the Sales Executive will work in collaboration with Account Managers and other IDS Sales Executives to identify opportunities for upsell and cross-sell within the existing account base. The Sales Executive is expected to have a comprehensive understanding of the customer use cases and business in general.  Client meetings, presentations and preparation of RFP/RFI responses will all be an integral part of the role, as well as interacting with customer, internal business partners, and pre sales on detailed aspects of a solution. This role is ideally suited to a self-motivated individual who relishes being at the forefront of business activities and thrives on their own successes and those of the team. We seek an aggressive hunter with polished sales, pipeline management, territory management and closing skills. A solid financial industry data or solutions background is preferred. Responsibilities Exceed sales quota Solid technical understanding of Index strategies Be a subject matter expert in terms of the index business and landscape in Asia Pacific Identifying competitive threats that could cause potential risk to our index business Keep abreast of regulatory changes that may benefit or damage our index business Manage territory and work closely with colleagues to identify and close new opportunities Managed and develop strong client relationships Work closely with the product and business team to provide feedback on any client, prospect or partner requirements CRM and pipeline management Knowledge and Experience 5+ years track record of over-achievement sales experience Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills required Clear ability to hunt within sales territory and build strong relationships with key client stakeholders Ability to accelerate the sales process; generating leads, managing the proposal process, overcoming objections Previous experience working within a data/software vendor, Exchange, or trading firm Strong network in the index space Previous experience of developing relationships from a cold call or networking activity is highly desirable Collaborative, team-oriented player with drive to contribute to individual and group results Proficient in pipeline management and forecasting Well-developed IT skills, notably MS PowerPoint & Excel and Salesforce CRM

JOB SCOPE Summary of Job Responsibilities Premium Services TMs provide personalized meet and greet services, enhance in-house guest experiences, and bid fond farewells to our VIP hotel guests. We strive to create an unforgettable memory by going above & beyond to fulfill their wishes. We follow up closely on guests’ requests to ensure they have been met and their expectations exceeded. Premium Services TMs are impeccably well-groomed, speak in clear and professional language, thank our guests with genuine appreciation and exudes a sense of elegance in our daily engagement. We aim to leave a long and lasting impression to our guests and make Marina Bay Sands a destination of choice. At Premium Services, we believe in the delivery of a seamless, luxurious, memorable guest journey. Job Responsibilities 1. Manage Day to Day Operations Acts as point of contact for Management Referral, Corporate Office of Senior Management, Wedding Couples, and other VIP’s for Hotel operations; provides individual assistance and accurate information throughout their stay. Efficiently and effectively manage communications prior to arrival and fulfilled in accordance with the policy established in order to increase customer satisfaction and maintain the warm and welcoming atmosphere of the Resort. Conduct daily briefing to ensure important information and updates are shared among team members. Ensure that a detailed handover is carry out between shifts including daily hotel occupancy, total assigned follow up for the day. Responsible for ensuring Premium Services emails are actively replied and/or actioned accordingly. Recommends and effectively upsells room types and property facilities in a sensitive and personalized manner. 2. Perform Service and Operational Excellence Handle meet and greet of VIPs as well as the arrival process of special attention and limousine arrival guests including room assignments. Anticipate guest needs, respond promptly, maintain positive guest relations and ensure an exceptional guest arrival experience. Preparation of daily Non-Gaming VIPs report for Senior Management Personally inspects VIP guestrooms and ensures readiness for a perfect arrival experience with set standards. Works closely with other related teams, and departments to ensure Premium Services requests/requirements are addressed and otherwise completed. 3. Apply Operational Risks Be aware of OSHA (Occupational Safety and Health Act), practices and reinforces safety guidelines. Report and document special incidents that command management’s attention; incidents may include vandalism, fight, fire, abuse, accidents, etc. Monitor activities in both front and back of the house; report any suspicious characters, items and/or activities to Security Department Respond emergency situations Respond to guest requirements as long as they are safe, legal and economically sound 4. Participate Employee Engagement Demonstrate an enjoyment and enthusiasm for work through effective relationships with other Team Members/ Department by embracing OneMBS culture. Self –motivate for continuous learning and development Undertake the role of mentoring new Team Members with front desk operations and procedures upon completion of their classroom training 5. Involve in Documentation, Financial and report management Attend scheduled departmental meetings as required. Review systems and processes for workflow and productivity improvement. Perform administrative duties such as inventory and filing of reports as required based on the assigned duty given within Groups Operations Team. Observe the usage of supplies to ensure that it’s within budget and minimize wastage. Contribute ideas in support of the company vision, mission, value and guiding principles Active involvement to sustainability programmes to drive organisational green initiatives Perform any other duties and responsibilities as and when assigned by Management 6. Lead Service and Operational Excellence Manage the delivery of services to guests consistent to the company’s core service standards, brand attributes and compliance. Ensure that all team members including self are well-mannered and always groomed as per company standard. Brainstorm and decide on ways in which operational flow can be improved. Demonstrate an enjoyment and enthusiasm for work through effective relationships with other Team Members/ Department by embracing OneMBS culture. Prepare reports (daily/weekly/monthly) as stipulated by management. Develop and maintain close liaison with all other Departments so as to have a good understanding of other Departments’ operational flow, thus ensuring seamless guest services throughout the hotel through effective communication and coordination. Perform any other duties and responsibilities as and when assigned by Management. JOB REQUIREMENTS Education & Certification Minimum GCE O Level. Diploma or Qualifications in Hospitality Management from a recognized institution is an added advantage. Experience Minimum 1 year experience in the same capacity Prior experience with Front Office, Guest Relations, or VIP Services preferred. Proficient in the use of Property Management System. Competencies Excellent guest relations and communication skills. Fluent in English & Mandarin, knowledge of additional languages is an advantage. PC Literacy and good typing skills. Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications Must have a good command of spoken and written English and Chinese is essential. A team player who is well organized and is able to work with minimum supervision. Pays attention to details and have strong customer service skills. Ability to think and respond quickly to last minute changes. Be willing to work flexible hours, any day and any shift in correlation with business demands. Well-groomed and professional disposition Mature, meticulous, resourceful, organized, and able to work independently. A team player and takes initiative to assist other Team Members when required. Have impeccable follow-through; and “Can Do” attitude and mindset. You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.

Job_Title: Project Coordinator / Project Manager, Client Solutions
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Sam Dakin Managing Director View profile & contact Project Coordinator / Project Management (PMO): As a Client Project Coordinator and Manager, you will deliver projects (non-IT) to support the successful delivery of training solutions to banking and financial services clients. Project Coordinator / Project Manager, Client Solutions Project Coordinator / Project Management (PMO): As a Client Project Coordinator and Manager, you will deliver projects (non-IT) to support the successful delivery of training solutions to banking and financial services clients. Key Objectives: Project budget, projects oversight, client engagement and project success. Work with clients on a consultative basis, being a critical point of contact, listening to their challenges and using both your own and the PMO team’s experience to propose innovative solutions and to deliver the project, sourcing ad-hoc resources to close gaps and managing relationships with third-party suppliers as required. Responsibilities: Develop project scope, specification, and deadline. Manage day-to-day operations of project delivery instilling a sense of urgency across teams. Manage internal and external stakeholders, keeping them updated on project progress. Track progress and work to manage project risks effectively and promptly. Participate in client governance for project delivery, working with senior client stakeholders to instil confidence in delivery. Work with relevant teams to develop and own project plans and associated documentation relating to delivery of projects within the PMO reporting framework. Source and on-board new resources to deliver project requirements. Challenge assumptions and propose alternate approaches to deliver the best result. Work with client documentation to validate solution deliverables against client requirements. Ensure relevant quality control processes in place for all deliverables. Meet financial objectives by forecasting requirements, preparing the budget; scheduling expenditures, analysing variances and initiating corrective actions. Ensure project documents and controls are complete, current, and appropriately filed or stored. Ensure PMO approach is followed through, and project documents and controls are complete, current, and appropriately filed or stored. Produce summary reporting for project steering groups, stakeholders, and clients. Role Requirements: (Please note this is not a technology/IT project manager/BA role) 8+ years of experience project managing multi-disciplinary solutions. B2B client delivery and project administration experience useful Track record of working closely with clients to develop innovative solutions. Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to interact with clients and senior level executives. Ability to work both strategically and hands on as required. Advantageous: Prince2 / Waterfall qualification/experience; Smartsheet; Agile Training/use of Agile methodology; experience of change management in project delivery. To find out more, please apply today. Sloane | Shorey Sloane Shorey Consulting is a specialist recruitment firm focusing on compliance, controls and risk management positions across Asia Pacific. Hiring_Company: Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine
Job_Descriptions: Assistant Director, Human Resources [LKCMedicine] This role is responsible for developing Learning and Development approaches to build Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine (LKCMedicine) organizational and workforce capability. This includes, but not limited to, conducting data analysis, generate insights, and propose recommendations to complement Learning & Organizational Development (L&OD) strategies, programmes, and processes to drive a high performing culture in LKCMedicine. He/She will also monitor and implement full range of HR Operations services, ensuring that they are effective and in accordance with the University's HR principles and policy; work with different stakeholders to shape the people strategies, execute all HR initiatives and drive HR excellence; assist in the end-to-end planning, management and implementation of HR projects and initiatives, while ensuring consistency with LKCMedicine's strategies and goals; and work in a multi-disciplinary and multi-cultural environment to provide support in the mentioned areas of HR duties. The role has a primary reporting line into the Office of Human Resources and a secondary reporting line into LKCMedicine. Key Responsibilities: Maintain good relationships with key stakeholders across the University. Decide on the need to escalate matters to the HR Cluster Lead and/or LKCMedicine management for attention/decision making. Work closely with key stakeholders to synthesize the current and future in-demand skills and identify learning gaps via competency gap analysis. Review learning strategies, practices and processes to enhance objectives, culture and efficiency of learning solutions and operations. Manage budget and implement various learning and development strategies. Conduct effective diagnosis in school, departments, and individuals, as well as evaluate on the effectiveness of the L&OD solutions applied. Build relationship as a trusted HR advisor to senior stakeholders and managers in LKCMedicine. Provide professional advice on the interpretation of HR policies and procedures, employment legislation, recruitment and rewards strategies, performance management, etc. Work with HRBP and HR Centre of Excellence in the implementation and delivery of key HR projects such as policy and process reviews, employee engagement surveys, people development programs, change management plans, People Strategy, key talent management processes and to communicate effectively organizational changes, rationales and implications to employees to ensure confidence and garner support. Manage all activities in relation to recruitment, appointment/reappointment and induction for management and support (MSO) and/or research staff. Deliver excellent employee experience, develop and execute the school agenda and people plans with the ultimate goal to achieve business results and employee experiences. Actively identify gaps, propose and implement changes where necessary to cover risks and improve work efficiency and effectiveness. Plan, implement and drive strategic focus projects or business process improvement. Ensure delivery of key project milestones and deliverables are on time and within budgeted resources, while complying with relevant organization policies and the required level of quality. Initiate improvements to internal HR processes, systems and communications towards enhancing service experiences. Maintain in-depth knowledge of legal requirements related to day-to-day management of employees, reducing legal risks and ensuring regulatory compliance. Provide advice to employees and manage the activities pertaining to industrial relations, employee grievances, conduct and discipline. Support other HR functions, including HR analytics, metrics and reporting. Key Requirements: Degree, preferably with specialization in Human Resource Management Minimum 8 years of relevant HR-related experience, particularly in organization development and/or training and development Proficiency in MS Office Applications (Word, PowerPoint, Excel et.) and HR systems, ideally in Workday Experience in project management and implementation Good knowledge of Employment Act and Labour Laws would be advantageous Comfortable operating in a matrix structure and in a constantly changing environment Ability to take initiative and work independently and collaboratively within the team Demonstrated ability to build and maintain effective interpersonal relationships at all levels Strong analytical thinking and communication skills both written and verbal Ability to handle sensitive matters with tact and discretion, while building trust and upholding confidentiality Outstanding attention to detail, follow-up and organizational skills Well-developed prioritization, time management and multi-tasking skills Ability to work well under pressure, meet deadlines and drive projects to completion

The Solution Architect as part of the System Integration team in iDirect is responsible for the various critical components of the business functions such as design and implementation turn key projects, presales activities such as tender bidding and requirements gathering, engineering prototyping to production of unique systems/ product lines, leading the engineering team in technical aspects and also supporting daily operation issues from the implementation team. He/ She is responsible for looking out for new technology areas not limited to Satellite communication domains to support business owners in business development strategies and planning. Responsibilities: Presales activities in requirements gatherings as well as tender bidding to support the global sales team Working with Project managers and customers to manage/ negotiate resources, scope and schedule Working closely with the product development teams on concepts, design and testing of new products till production phase Manage the activities of the vendors and partners to ensure systems are delivered in timely manner Effective communication on the updates to senior managements on the progress in various domain such as engineering development works, project delivery schedules and resource management issues Evaluate and recommendations of new and emerging technologies to the augment to current technological roadmap Documentations and test plan review Requirements: BS in Electrical/ Electronic Engineering or, equivalent Have at least 10 years experience in system engineering design for satellite communication business not limited to performance analysis of satellite communication systems, satellite terminal, satellite-based networks Experienced in operating RF, Antennas, WAN/LAN equipment as well as test instruments Experienced in on-site deployments of satellite terminals and troubleshooting Good understanding of GEO, LEO and MEO telecommunications and systems and in-depth knowledge of VSAT systems that includes link budget analysis and network optimization Excellent writing and presentation skills in working with both technical and non-technical staff Sense of ownership in work and competitive drive and meticulous in his/ her work Ability to work in a fast pace environment with speed and focus

Job Responsibilities Support on Facility Management - HVAC / ACMV Track, verify, analyze and report energy & water consumptions across the organization. Prepare periodic reports detailing energy and water consumption usage against target. Perform preliminary energy audits to identify, develop, plan and execute energy & water efficiency and conservation improvement projects to enable MBS to achieve its energy and water reduction targets and other related key performance indicators. Assist to prepare and submit formal documentation for new projects, including project cost and energy savings. Conduct Measurement and Verification (M&V) on energy & water savings derived from such projects. Review results and establish further action plans. Conduct continuous/regular site audit inspections to identify areas where energy is wasted to develop conservation measures (architectural, mechanical, electrical, etc.) Provide continuous improvement recommendations for optimizing existing equipment control strategies. Utilize analytics to provide fault detection and diagnostics of building control systems. Keeping up to date with latest regulatory requirements related to energy and water consumption. Keeping abreast and updated on latest technology (such as renewable and alternative energy) and implement potential initiatives. Establish IoT-enhanced building energy management solutions to improve observability and flexibility of usage monitoring. JOB REQUIREMENTS Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in the fields of Mechanical, Electrical, Building Services, Facilities Management or equivalent. Candidates without the required qualifications but with adequate experience in similar position may apply. Singapore Certified Energy Manager (SCEM) certification would be an added advantage. Demonstration of personal commitment and curiosity to be involved in continuously upgrading one-self through various learning channels will be an advantage. At least 2 years solid hand-on practical engineer experience in large-scale properties such as Integrated Resort, Hospitality, Mixed Development, MICE etc. providing engineering services, operation supports, and/or operations & maintenance of the facilities, plants, and systems, of which at least 1 year should be, involved in HVAC / ACMV energy & water conservation roles. Preference will be given to those with strong knowledge/experience in HVAC, Pumps, Metering / Instrumentation / Controls and Chillers / Heat Exchangers. Building automation and computer engineering software / hardware background would be added advantage. Experience in energy audits and managing Green Mark Certification projects would be advantageous. Experience in application and utilizing of technologies to drive energy conservation, process and efficiency improvements. Be able to perform work in the Casino i.e., should not be included in the Casino Exclusion program. You agree that it is a condition of employment that you adhere to and abide by all rules, regulations, policies and procedures including without limitation the rules of conduct of the Company.

Job_Title: Senior Associate, LazMall Channel and Buyer Experience - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Job Description Lazada is the No. 1 online shopping & selling destination in Southeast Asia – present in Indonesia, Malaysia, the Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. Lazada helps more than 145,000 local and international sellers as well as 3,000 brands serve the 560 million consumers in the region through its marketplace platform, supported by a wide range of tailored marketing, data, and service solutions. Southeast Asia is the next big internet market and global melting point for the whole world e-commerce. You will be responsible for: Develop a deep understanding of the business across the entire value chain, including commercial, logistics, marketing, product and technology, customer insights through close collaboration with the various functions and regional teams Develop fundamental market, consumer and customer understanding which forms the basis of the end-to-end channel experience Understand the end-to-end shopping journey and develop action plans at each touchpoint to elevate the customers experience Gather market and internal data, translates them into insights that help optimize the customer journey, identify process issues and ensure compliance with policies Review existing and future business directions and make specific requests about what new innovations and features will help to improve customer experience, satisfaction and loyalty Set up guidelines, process, templates and metrics for campaign governance and mechanics and enable daily execution within the channel to drive traffic efficiency and awareness Work with product team to implement front-end product features and UI/UX design requirements in line with the business strategy and channel branding Dissect the business processes with various function/regional teams to identify data that needs tracking and how it can be used to improve the local channel operations. Job Requirements Obsessed with customers and data to drive strategic and operational changes to the shopping experience on the channel At least 4-6 years of experience in consumer marketing, customer experience and analytics Possess a proven ability to translate numbers and further them into insights for business use Strong communications and stakeholder management skillsets are critical to the success of this role Strong understanding of E-commerce ecosystem and how shoppers interact with marketplace platforms Good understanding of consumer profile and shopping habits in SEA markets Ability to think out-of-the-box and working experiences with FMCG companies, retailers and customer analytics functions will be a plus A self-motivated, driven and flexible mentality Resourceful with working experiences within a super fast-paced environment

Job_Title: VP – FP&A/Performance Management – Credit Cards & Personal Loans
Job_Descriptions: Posted by: Michael Durkin Associate Director - Specialist in recruitment in the Finance and CFO space for Banking & FS View profile & contact Our client is a leading International Bank, who are looking for an AVP level FP&A / Performance Management candidate to join their consumer banking business, focusing specifically on the Credit Cards and Personal Loans segment. This role will be responsible for supporting the consumer banking team to deliver insightful performance management reports, driving strategic decision making and business planning within the Credit Cards and Personal Loans business. Some of the key responsibilities will include: Manage the preparation of management information reports for Credit Cards & Personal Loans to support timely and accurate assessment of financial performance including tracking against targets. Continuously provide a balanced view of business performance against agreed external & internal benchmarks to drive optimal decisions, superior performance, and appropriate rewards. Partner relevant Credit Cards & Personal Loans business heads in the development of strategy and its translation into specific operational & financial plans. Provide the business with options, recommendations and clear financial consequences based on robust analysis and a transparent decision-making framework. Have a full understanding on cost levers for Credit Cards & Personal Loans, including cost of acquisitions, marketing campaigns costs through effective and analytical cost monitoring. Ensure costs & investments are aligned to business strategy, deliver targeted returns and that a culture of continuous productivity improvement is embedded in business processes. Provide an efficient budgeting, forecasting & reporting platform for Credit Cards & Personal Loans which delivers accurate business information in the shortest cycle time and at lowest cost, to release capacity for value creation activities. The ability to interpret the overall financial information, identify key issues based on this information and put in place appropriate controls and measures. Maintain robust process around Balance Sheet Substantiation and coordinate with relevant stakeholders for the timely resolution of overdue balances. To be eligible for this role you will require: Relevant 5 + years Financial Planning & Analysis experience in supporting business financial analysis, preferably with experience in Credit Cards and Personal Loans. Experience of managing a diverse range of stakeholders both inside and outside of finance teams. Please contact Michael Durkin on +65 8894 1963 or email your cv directly in word format with job reference no. Jo0000006409 to bankingandfinance-SG@theedgepartnership.com. Please note that due to the high number of applications only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. Posted by: Jacylnn Tan Onsite Recruitment Lead View profile & contact Business Analyst, Product Change Who we're looking for Schroders is rolling out a range of highly complex change programs across our Product division, which comprises of our global Product, Marketing & Solutions teams. Such programs include the Program Governance Change Programme (itself consisting of 3 separate projects) that is likely to continue for the next few years. The need to implement such global programs in APAC is complicated as each APAC country have their peculiar requirements in terms of legal, regulatory and business customs, sometimes very different from those of the UK. The projects and activities led by the successful individual will support Schroders aim's of becoming a top-tier asset manager by ensuring compliance with laws & regulations and where possible delivering and maintaining products more efficiently. We require an individual with an excellent track record of analysing & documenting business processes, preferably in financial services. It is expected that the individual will be able to work effectively with a broad range of SMEs as well as communicate effectively with the UK project team. The Business Analyst, Product Change will be accountable to the Chief Administrative Officer, Japan who has an additional regional role working closely with the APAC Head of Product on all Product change and project initiatives. The individual will also be accountable to the Head of Technology and Change for APAC as well as a link to the global Product Change team via the Business Transformation Lead for the Product and Solutions division. About Schroders We're a global investment manager. We help institutions, intermediaries and individuals around the world invest money to meet their goals, fulfil their ambitions, and prepare for the future. We have around 4,000 people on six continents. And we've been around for over 200 years, but keep adapting as society and technology changes. What doesn't change is our commitment to helping our clients, and society, prosper. The base Singapore The team You will be part of the APAC Change team, with responsibility for projects within the APAC Product and Marketing division. You will therefore be working closely with the local Product and Marketing teams across the region. What you'll do Manage the delivery of projects and activities in relation to the roll-out of Global change programmes in the APAC region Work with the senior stakeholders to ensure clear, consistent reporting and to ensure that the deliverables of projects remain clearly focused on targeted outcome. Work with all relevant business stakeholders, including Product Development, Marketing, Legal and Compliance. Co-ordinate project committees and working group meetings as required. With the support of relevant stakeholders, create and maintain project plans with clear milestones. Support communication of progress and changes to the wider organisation Manage dependencies across the programme. Ensure programme, project and local are delivered in adherence with Group Change policies Manage effective project handovers, monitor post implementation results and feedback. The knowledge, experience and qualifications you need Experience and knowledge of Financial Services, preferably Asset Management. Proven track record as a business analyst with experience of Investment, Operational and product life cycle business processes Methodical and detail orientated. Evidence of capability to manage multiple senior stakeholders Strong collaborative skills and when appropriate influence across a broad, senior stakeholder base. Ability to deliver difficult messages where necessary and the ability to explain complex concepts in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders. Evidence of resolving challenging issues and contributing to end state solutions. Able to make trade-offs to ensure priority value items are delivered. Can drive to make decisions. The knowledge, experience and qualifications that will help Basic professional qualifications relating to the asset management industry (IOC/CFA) Relevant Programme / Project Management qualifications (PMP/PMI) Understanding and experience of both Agile and Waterfall delivery models Knowledge and experience of applying Lean business process analysis (Desired) You'll be like Inspiring and collaborative team player Friendly, approachable, enjoys working with people from a variety of backgrounds Comfortable with ambiguity and change Receptive to others' ideas and responds constructively to challenges Committed to exceeding expectations with your personal drive and quality performance. We're looking for the best, whoever they are Schroders is an equal opportunities employer. You're welcome here whatever your sex, marital status, ethnic origin, sexual orientation, religious belief or age. .

Job_Title: Audit (Internal Audit) - Technology Audit Manager - Singapore
Job_Descriptions: Audit (Internal Audit) - Technology Audit Manager - Singapore Company Profile Morgan Stanley is a leading global financial services company providing a wide range of investment banking/ securities/ investment management and wealth management services. The Firms employees serve clients worldwide including corporations/ governments and individuals from more than 1200 offices in 43 countries. As a market leader/ the talent and passion of our people is critical to our success. Together/ we share a common set of values rooted in integrity/ excellence and strong team ethic. Morgan Stanley can provide a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn/ to achieve and grow. A philosophy that balances personal lifestyles/ perspectives and needs is an important part of our culture. Our core values: Committing to Diversity and Inclusion/ Putting Clients First/ Doing the Right Thing/ Leading with Exceptional Ideas and Giving Back underpin everything we do in Morgan Stanley. Department Profile Internal Audit Department (IAD) is responsible for validating whether the Firm operates in a controlled environment with appropriate risk management processes. Auditors evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of the Firms internal controls using a risk-based methodology developed from professional auditing standards. IAD assists in monitoring the Firms compliance with internal guidelines set for risk management and risk monitoring/ as well as external rules and regulations governing the industry. The team reports directly to the Board Audit Committee and helps verify whether the Firm meets all of its fiduciary responsibilities to shareholders/ while adhering to corporate-governance standards and legal and regulatory requirements. IAD comprises of a team of auditors with a diverse skill sets in business/ compliance and financial crimes/ risk management/ operations/ finance/ information security and technology/ working together to identify/ monitor/ assess and report on the control environment of the Firm. Asia IAD/ as the 3rd Line of Defence (LOD)/ is responsible for audits across all Morgan Stanley businesses/ support and control functions/ including the 1st and 2nd LOD/ in the region. The audits are designed to assess the adequacy of the control environment and to provide the Board Audit Committee and relevant regional committees with an independent assessment of risk across the Firm. IAD continues to strive to provides insightful viewpoints on leading indicators and topical matters that are most relevant to the Firm/ use the most effective and cutting-edge means to accurately evaluate the stability of risk controls/ and empower its team members to contribute and succeed in their career. Role Description Morgan Stanley IAD is currently seeking an experienced Technology Audit Manager for its Singapore-based audit team with a focus on the application and system infrastructure controls that impact the business risks. Based in Singapore and reporting locally to Head of Singapore Internal Audit and functionally to the Head of Technology Audit based in Hong Kong/ the successful candidate will be supporting the Singapore and Asia audit teams to perform risk assessments/ planning/ execution and reporting of regional and global audits/ and continuous monitoring activities.

Job_Title: Part Time Team Member ALL LOCATIONS - OPEN INTERVIEW (Singapore)
Job_Descriptions: Lovisa was created out of a need for on-trend fashion jewellery at ready-to-wear prices. Our trend spotting departments worldwide take inspiration from couture runways and current street style to deliver new, must-have styles to our customers.\ We are a fashion-forward jewellery brand that caters to every woman, with 150 new styles being delivered to stores each week. We give exceptional customer service and apply our core belief, “It’s about the customer, always” in everything we do. Established in Australia Lovisa launched its first store in 2010, Since then Lovisa has opened over 550 stores across 20 countries: New Zealand, The United States, Singapore, Malaysia, South Africa, United Kingdom, France, Germany, Belgium, Netherlands, Switzerland, Austria, Luxembourg. As we continue to grow, vast opportunities will arise and are on offer for self-motivated and enthusiastic leaders and Team Members. We are now looking for an enthusiastic and motivated Stylists to join our team! Apply here https://lola.worldmanager.com/careers/ for an express video interview prior to the listed dates. Please come along to our open interviews! SATURDAY 5TH FEBRUARY 2022 Lovisa IMM (11am - 5pm) Lovisa Tampines Mall (11am - 5pm) Recruiting for ALL STORES IN SINGAPORE! Walk-in to any of these locations listed for an interview, and choose stores around Singapore you would like to work in. What to bring: Current resume and Dress to Impress! Please apply to confirm your place at our session! Lovisa will benefits: - Great opportunities for growth and development - Fantastic discounts and incentives - A culture that is committed to continuous improvement - Opportunity to join one of Australia’s fastest and most successful global retail brand! To be successful in this role you will have: - The passion to work within a team to deliver great results - Strong background in retail sales - Ability to perform in a fast-paced, high volume retail environment - Exceptional communication & customer service skills - Enthusiasm and initiative - A love for fashion and great confidence to style your Customer with any look they want to create! What we are looking for! - Do you love working in a team environment dedicated to offering an exceptional experience to your Customer? - Are you motivated and driven to deliver great results? - Are you a great communicator and confident in building great relationships? - Do you have an eye for fashion and are in the know on all the latest trends? Then we would love to talk to you about a becoming a stylist with Lovisa!

Job_Title: AVP, IT Audit Manager/Senior IT Auditor (App), Digital & Technology Audit, Group Audit
Job_Descriptions: AVP, IT Audit Manager/Senior IT Auditor (App), Digital & Technology Audit, Group Audit OCBC Bank is the longest established Singapore bank, formed in 1932 from the merger of three local banks, the oldest of which was founded in 1912. It is now the second largest financial services group in Southeast Asia by assets and one of the world's most highly-rated banks, with an Aa1 rating from Moody's. Recognised for its financial strength and stability, OCBC Bank is consistently ranked among the World's Top 50 Safest Banks by Global Finance and has been named Best Managed Bank in Singapore by The Asian Banker. Division Description Group Audit provides objective assurance that the Group functions effectively to accomplish its objectives within the established risk appetite. We adopt a risk-based systematic approach to evaluate and provide recommendations to improve the effectiveness of internal control, risk management and governance processes. Apart from business unit-specific audit departments, find opportunities within our Regulatory Capital Audit, Credit Risk Review, Investigation, Audit Methodology & Standards and Programme Management Office departments. Key Responsibilities: Audit Management Plan and manage audit engagements and ensure that relevant technology, information and cyber risks and control gaps and lapses have been identified, appropriately assessed, and reported. Conduct audits/reviews on Applications, IT Infrastructure, as well as Information, Cyber and Digitalisation risks. Support business audits by providing technology audit expertise and evaluate the IT controls supporting business operations. Assist the Head of Department/Senior Audit Manager in the delivery of their role and responsibilities. Stakeholder Management Work as business partners with stakeholders across the Group, and assist the HOD/Senior Audit Manager to better manage business and Technology, Information, Cyber, and Digital risks. Communicate audits/reviews observations and writing audit and ad-hoc reports for delivery to, and agreement with, auditees. Team Management Possesses qualities essential as a leader over a team of auditors for assigned audit engagements/reviews Complete working papers for audits/reviews through documenting the work conducted, describing the work performed and the evidence that supports the observations and conclusions, as well as reviewing the work performed by other team members. Qualifications The ideal Candidate will meet the following requirements: University Degree in Computer Science or a related discipline Professional certifications such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) or Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) (For AVP) Minimum 6 years of working experience, with at least 4 years in IT audit (For MGR) Minimum 4 years of working experience, with at least 2 years in IT audit Willing and able to operate effectively in a leadership position or a team player Independent and committed with high level of initiative Good written, verbal communication and presentation skills Strong interpersonal and communications skills High level of integrity, drive, and sense of urgency Willing to travel 10%-20% (MY/CN primarily, with occasional worldwide) At OCBC, we recognise your drive, passion and talent. We will bring out the best in you and empower you to excel. Fulfil your life goals and career ambitions with us. *We regret that only shortlisted Candidates will be notified.

About Certis We are a leading security services organisation. We put technology to work in making the world a safer place. Our mission is that as trusted partners, we protect lives and assets, and deliver integrated critical services. By empowering our people, our goal is to enable our communities to stay safe and thriving. We offer a broad range of opportunities and career pathways for our people to grow and explore their potential. We believe that people, equipped with innovative thinking and technological capabilities will make the world safer, smarter and better. Life at Certis If you are a passionate individual looking for opportunities to expand your skills, and purposeful work instead of just a 'job', we would love to hear from you. At Certis, no two days look alike. Our work calendars are filled with chances to collaborate with others, and bring new initiatives to life. Whether you're looking to improve a process, or have an innovative idea awaiting a technology solve, we want you to bring your ideas to the table. We are a close-knit team that looks out for each other, works hard to get the job done, and encourages each other to grow - the perfect place for you to grow your career! Duties & Responsibilities Answer calls coming into the helpdesk Serve as the first point of contact for customers seeking technical assistance over the phone or email Direct the customer to articulate the suspected fault through carefully designed questions Identify the issue encountered by the customer and open the right support ticket in the system Determine the solution based on the issue and details provided by customers Understand the required skills and knowledge to resolve clients issue Coordinate with maintenance support team to resolve clients concern Arrange appointment with the client for follow up Monitor and follow up on all outstanding support ticket Record events and problems and their resolution in logs Follow-up and update customer status and information Pass on any feedback or suggestions by customers to the appropriate internal team Preparation of reports Identify and suggest possible improvements on procedures Monitor and respond to all incoming security signals in accordance to established procedures Use technology to improve efficiency in handling letters and reporting, in managing office communication and scheduling, and in documents and archival management etc. Skills & Experience Minimum NITEC in any discipline preferably in Engineering/ Information Technology or Customer Service related field Candidates with Customer Service or helpdesk background are preferred Able to speak English fluently Customer-oriented and cool-tempered Preferably with basic understanding of networking and the mechanics of extra low voltage systems Willing to perform both Morning & Night duties Working location Commonwealth Demonstrated ability to use simple video conferencing & cloud documentation tools (e.g. Zoom, TEAMS, O365 etc.) Recognition & Reward What you can expect from us: Work on projects for world-class security projects renowned for their safety, reliability and efficiency Commitment to your ongoing development, including on-the-job opportunities, formal programs and assistance with further education Community volunteering opportunities A competitive remuneration package, featuring performance-based incentives and a medical insurance and dental allowance. Certis is committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workforce culture, which is supported by our Compass values. Our aim is to attract, develop and retain a truly diverse and high-performing workforce.

Job_Title: AVP, Wholesale Operational Readiness Centre, Group Technology & Ops
Job_Descriptions: About UOB United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices. Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers. About the Department The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches. Job Responsibilities You will be part of the Wholesale Operational Readiness Centre that supports Cash Management/ Trade Finance/ Loans/ Channels Operations Centers, with effective implementation of Technology changes, reviewing Requirements from End User perspective, and ensure implementation through effective Testing, Training and Documentation. Your key responsibilities are: Understand Business Requirements and Functional Specs documents Learn and master TOSCA tool which is a software testing tool used at UOB to design test cases and automate end to end testing Understand Test Case Design developed in TOSCA for the technology change Drive testing delivery as per the test strategy and test plan Create instances in TOSCA for multiple test data combinations Perform Exploratory Test Case execution Perform Test Case automation in TOSCA for identified modules Report defects in tracking system and follow-through on defect resolution Conduct training to impacted operations and/ or business users Provide post-implementation support to operations users Job Requirements Bachelor's degree/ Diploma holder Operations experience is a must (Cash Management/ Trade Finance/ Loans/ Channels operations) Proficient computer skills Strong analytical skills Good communication and interpersonal skills Able to work independently and in a team Be a part of UOB Family UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application. Apply now and make a difference.

Burkert with headquarters in Germany, is one of the leading manufacturers of measurement and control systems for liquids and gases. Present in 36 countries, their products and systems are used in brewery technology, laboratory and medical technology as well as space technology in more than 300 different industries. What makes Burkert so special? Above all, our corporate culture. It is strongly characterised by the concept of partnership. We do not waste energy on superfluous hierarchies; instead, our cooperation is defined primarily by working and interacting at eye level. That is also the central idea among our executives. The focus is not on orders and control, but rather on the support and development of employees. Open doors go without saying. This creates trust and hence the courage to go new ways together. Our employees experience this atmosphere of respect and appreciation as an opportunity to grow with their responsibilities. Each individual has the chance to develop in accordance with his or her abilities and strengths, to use the freedom offered and to take on responsibility. As a real partner in a successful team. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work in a dynamic and challenging, yet collaborative work environment, equipping him or her with the necessary skills, training and motivation to thrive in the industry. The following is what you should have experience with: Role Instrumentation and Controls Engineer is an expert in a field/area of work, has the skillset to recommend technical guidelines and makes expertise available to other departments/teams. Responsibilities: Support on product and application presentation to potential and existing customers Participate in brain storming of ideas/special projects include implementation. Technical support to sales team and assist in identifying and highlighting potential issues. Participates and contributes in project management involving costing, Bill of Material (BOM) including third party product, scheduling, etc. Project / Systems configuration and coordination Prepare routine engineering drawings and specifications. Provides technical support by utilising configuration and sizing tools Preparing of System for trial at customer site. Build a system for customer and bring it there for trial purpose. Post Sales (ETO Only) Finalise (including technical verification) BOM and create in SAP Preparing of the initial (first time) procurement of BOM Carry out the assembly, function test, Factory Acceptance Test and related documentation prior to delivery Programing and Pre-setting of product before delivery, documenting and archiving them On site product / system commissioning / trouble shooting and servicing and also inhouse trouble shooting technical related issue Back-up for Product Assembly Communicate new product launch + Training Setup-demo units for training / exhibition Prepare product/system for customer evaluation Develop standard system solution that has high cross selling potential Continuous improvement of engineering know-hows to add value to the order wining team Support Sales Directives & Tactics (SD&T) implementation Requirements: Degree in Electronics/Mechanical Engineering with 3 to 5 years of experience Experienced in instrumentation and controls, PLC knowledge will be an advantage Familiar with process automation Relevant experience in Pharmaceutical or F&B industry

Job_Descriptions: Senior Associate, Network Specialist - Application Delivery Network (ADN), Technology & Operations - (WD28738) Business Function Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation.
